item.title: Report X-2024100094
item.description:
Report X-2024100094

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER (DR) RECEIVED A CALL TO RETRIEVE A LEAKING PACKAGE FROM THE SMALLS SORT. DR RETRIEVED PACKAGE AND RETURNED TO THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER (PSC). DR OPENED THE WET PACKAGE AND SAW THE PRODUCT WAS 99% ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL. DR WILL DISPOSE OF CONTETS VIA SOLIDIFICATION PER THE DAMAGED MATERIALS PROGRAM PROTOCOL.

item.title: Report X-2024100138
item.description:
Report X-2024100138

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER (DR) RECEIVED A CALL TO RETRIEVE A LEAKING PACKAGE. DR BROUGHT THE LEAKING PACKAGE BACK TO THE CENTRAL PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER(PSC)CAGE. DR TRIAGED PACKAGE AND FOUND SEVERAL BOTTLES TO BE LEAKING. DR PLACED A SERVICE CROSS ON THE PACKAGE. A SECOND DR TRIAGED THE LEAKING CONTENTS USING THE WASTE DISPOSAL CHART AND DOWNLOADED THE SAFETY DATA SHEET (SDS). THE SDS SHOWED THIS PRODUCT WAS A CLASS 8 BUT COULD PASS AS LIMITED QUANTITY. AFTER SECOND DR CONFIRMED THE OUTER PACKAGING DID NOT HAVE ANY LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND OR ANY HAZARDOUS MARKINGS, THE HAZARDOUS MATERIALS SERVICE CENTER (HMSC) WAS CONTACTED. NATHANIEL AT THE HMSC TOOK THE INFORMATION AND DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS CONSIDERED UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report X-2024091598
item.description:
Report X-2024091598

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-11
  • City: HILLSBORO
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKER WAS FOUND SITUATED SIDEWAYS IN THE LOWER PORTION OF THE LAST SECTION OF A TIER IN A TRAILER PARKED AT DOOR 10. THERE WERE DEFINITIVE MARKINGS ON THE BOX INDICATING THAT IT WAS FOR PACKAGING A HAZMAT. RESPONDER CHECKED THE SDS AND FOUND TWO SDS WITH DIFFERING INFORMATION IN SECTION 14. CALLED THE HMSC. THEY VERIFIED IT WAS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report I-2024090034
item.description:
Report I-2024090034

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: Portland
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At PDX, on 8/19/2024, Delta's Dangerous Goods Management team received an incident report where a shipment that contained dry ice was transported from LAX to PDX undeclared. The courier whom picked up the packages stated there was 20 kg of dry ice per container. However, there was no dry ice statement on the air waybill, no Special Handling Code(SPL) entries or NOTOC produced for the flight. Additionally, there were no labels or markings indicating dry ice on the packages. The description noted in the cargo booking system states,"empty Packaging, comat non haz". This event is under investigation.
